original: @110a # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @110a # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: pra dznya p'a ra mi t'a pint'a rtha n'a ma /
analyzed: pra dznya p'a ra mi t'a pint'a rtha n'a ma /
translated: Prajnaparamita-pitaka-arthanama

original: bod skad du /üîΩshes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus pa zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bod skad du / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i don bsdus pa zhes bya ba /
translated: In Tibetan:üîΩPrajnaparamita-pitaka-arthanama

original: dang po yum la dang ba skyed pa'i don du mkhyen pa gsum gyi yon tan gyi sgo nas yum la phyag 'tshal ba bstan to //
analyzed: dang po yum la dang ba skyed pa'i don du mkhyen pa gsum gyi yon tan gyi sgo nas yum la phyag 'tshal ba bstan to //
translated: Homage to the Mother, the Perfection of Wisdom, in the form of the three wisdoms, in order to generate faith in the Mother at the beginning.

original: de nas 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid kyi bstan bcos don lnga dang ldan par ston par bzhed pas dgos pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas 'phags pa byams pa bdag nyid kyi bstan bcos don lnga dang ldan par ston par bzhed pas dgos pa bstan to //
translated: Then, the noble Maitreya, wishing to teach his treatise with five topics, taught the purpose.

original: dgos pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: dgos pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The purpose is twofold:

original: brgyud pa'i sgo nas dang / dngos kyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud pa'i sgo nas dang / dngos kyi dgos pa'o //
translated: The indirect purpose and the direct purpose.

original: blo dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa'i dgos pa'o ;
analyzed: blo dang ldan pa byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi lam mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni brgyud pa'i dgos pa'o ;
translated: The indirect purpose is stated: The wise bodhisattvas will actualize the path to omniscience.

original: / bde blag tu rtogs pa ni rtsom pa'i dngos kyi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: / bde blag tu rtogs pa ni rtsom pa'i dngos kyi dgos pa'o //
translated: The direct purpose is easy to understand.

original: de nas tshigs su bcad pa bco lngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nas tshigs su bcad pa bco lngas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa bstan to //
translated: Then, in fifteen verses, he teaches the arrangement of the body of the perfection of wisdom.

original: de la dang po gnyis kyis mdor bstan la /
analyzed: de la dang po gnyis kyis mdor bstan la /
translated: Therein, the first two are the brief teaching.

original: bcu gsum gyis ni cung zhig rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: bcu gsum gyis ni cung zhig rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The thirteen are the extensive teaching.

original: mdo'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang po gnyis kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun mngon par rtogs pa brgyad du bsdus par bstan to //
analyzed: mdo'i tshig le'ur byas pa dang po gnyis kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa kun mngon par rtogs pa brgyad du bsdus par bstan to //
translated: The first two verses of the sutra in verse form teach the perfection of wisdom as summarized in eight realizations.

original: de la gnyis te /
analyzed: de la gnyis te /
translated: Therein, there are two topics:

original: grangs nges pa dang / go rims nges pa'o //
analyzed: grangs nges pa dang / go rims nges pa'o //
translated: the ascertainment of number and the ascertainment of sequence.

original: de la grangs nges pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa @110b gnyis so //
analyzed: de la grangs nges pa ni mngon par rtogs pa brgyad ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i bdag nyid kyis rnam pa @110b gnyis so //
translated: As for the ascertainment of number, the eight realizations are twofold in nature, as cause and effect.

original: rgyu ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bdun yin la /
analyzed: rgyu ni dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i sbyor ba'i bye brag gis mngon par rtogs pa rnam pa bdun yin la /
translated: The cause is the seven realizations, distinguished by the specific application of the object,

original: brgyad pa ni 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: brgyad pa ni 'bras bu'o //
translated: and the eighth is the effect.

original: mkhyen pa gsum ni dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa gsum ni dmigs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: The three knowledges are the teaching of the object.

original: lhag ma mngon par rtogs pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma mngon par rtogs pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The remaining four realizations are the preparation.

original: 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: The result is the Dharma body.

original: de la bdun tsam gyis ni mi rdzogs la /
analyzed: de la bdun tsam gyis ni mi rdzogs la /
translated: It is not complete with just seven,

original: dgu phan chad ni 'bras bu med pas grangs nges pa'o //
analyzed: dgu phan chad ni 'bras bu med pas grangs nges pa'o //
translated: and there is no result with more than nine.

original: go rims nges pa ni 'bras bu la brod pa skyed pa'i don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang por bstan to //
analyzed: go rims nges pa ni 'bras bu la brod pa skyed pa'i don du rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang por bstan to //
translated: The certainty of sequence is as follows: The knowledge of all aspects is taught first in order to generate enthusiasm for the result.

original: de nyid lam goms pa las byung bas de'i rjes la lam shes pa bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid lam goms pa las byung bas de'i rjes la lam shes pa bstan to //
translated: Since that itself arises from cultivating the path, knowledge of the path is taught after that.

original: de nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas spang bya bzhi shes de'i rjes la bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'i bdag nyid yin pas spang bya bzhi shes de'i rjes la bstan to //
translated: Since that itself is the nature of abandoning counteragents, knowledge of the four abandonments is taught after that.

original: 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'dod pas sgrub pa nyams su blang dgos pas /
analyzed: 'bras bu thams cad mkhyen pa thob par 'dod pas sgrub pa nyams su blang dgos pas /
translated: Since one who wishes to attain the result, the knowledge of all aspects, must practice the means of attainment,

original: de yang las dang po pa'i gnas skabs nas yin pas las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su go cha'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba de'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de yang las dang po pa'i gnas skabs nas yin pas las dang po pa'i gnas skabs su go cha'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa zhes bya ba de'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: Moreover, since it is from the stage of the beginner, it is the application of the beginner's stage, called the realization of the armor practice in every way.

original: de nyid mthar thug pa las 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rab kyi sbyor ba'o //üîΩrtse mo de nyid kyi dbang du bya ba'i phyir ram ;
analyzed: de nyid mthar thug pa las 'jug pa'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid rtse mo'i mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba rab kyi sbyor ba'o // rtse mo de nyid kyi dbang du bya ba'i phyir ram ;
translated: That very [realization] is the application of the best, called the peak realization, the nature of the practice of engagement.üîΩFor the sake of that very peak,

original: nyams na gso ba'i don /
analyzed: nyams na gso ba'i don /
translated: or for the purpose of mending if it degenerates,

original: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i bdag nyid mthar gyis pa zhes bya ba go rims kyis sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi sgrub pa'i bdag nyid mthar gyis pa zhes bya ba go rims kyis sbyor ba'o //
translated: is the application of the sequence, called the gradual practice, the nature of the practice of the assembly.

original: de nyid mthar thug pas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba mthar phyin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid mthar thug pas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa'i bdag nyid skad cig ma gcig la mngon par rtogs pa zhes bya ba mthar phyin pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: That very [practice] is the application of the consummate, called the realization in one instant, the nature of the practice of definite emergence.

original: de'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung bas brgyad pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung bas brgyad pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku mdzad pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The second moment of that is the result, the dharmakƒÅya, so the eighth is the dharmakƒÅya with its activity.

original: de ni go rims nges pa'o //
analyzed: de ni go rims nges pa'o //
translated: That is the definite order.

original: don brgyad po de yang bsdus na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don brgyad po de yang bsdus na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those eight topics are also summarized as two:

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'o //
translated: cause and result.

original: yang na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or they are summarized as three:

original: dmigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / sbyor ba dang / 'bras bu'o //
translated: the object, the application, and the result.

original: de la dang po gsum ni dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang po gsum ni dmigs pa'o //
translated: Among those, the first three are the object.

original: de'i sbyor ba dang / rab dang / go rims dang / mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis rnam par kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sbyor ba dang / rab dang / go rims dang / mthar phyin pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis rnam par kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa bzhi ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: The four, such as the complete realization of all aspects, are the application, which is divided into the application, the supreme, the order, and the culmination.

original: chos kyi sku ni 'bras bu'o //üîΩde la @111a * //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni 'bras bu'o // de la @111a * //
translated: The dharmakƒÅya is the result.

original: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad du nges par bstan pa ni dbang po rtul po dang 'bring gi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa brgyad du nges par bstan pa ni dbang po rtul po dang 'bring gi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the ascertainment of the eight realizations is from the perspective of those of dull and medium faculties.

original: rnon po la ni drug gis mchog go //
analyzed: rnon po la ni drug gis mchog go //
translated: For those of sharp faculties, the supreme is taught with six.

original: sgrub pa bzhi lam dang sbyar na go cha'i sbyor ba'i lam /üîΩ'jug pa mthong ba'i lam /
analyzed: sgrub pa bzhi lam dang sbyar na go cha'i sbyor ba'i lam / 'jug pa mthong ba'i lam /
translated: If the four kinds of practice are applied to the path, the practice of armor is included in the path of preparation.

original: tshogs bsgom ma pa'i lam /
analyzed: tshogs bsgom ma pa'i lam /
translated: The practice of engagement is included in the path of seeing.üîΩThe practice of meditation on the collections is included in the path of meditation.

original: nges par 'byung ba bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba bsgom pa'i lam gyi khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus te /
translated: The practice of definite emergence is included in the special path of meditation.

original: mdor na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: mdor na rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa mngon par rtogs pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: In brief, the four kinds of clear realization are by nature the complete realization of all aspects and so on.

original: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa tshogs kyi lam gyis bsdus pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn't the complete realization of all aspects included in the path of accumulation?

original: ji ltar go cha sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar go cha sbyor ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the path of preparation?

original: go cha'i sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su rdzogs pa la dgongs pas na sbyor ba'i lam zhes brjod do //
analyzed: go cha'i sbyor ba ni sbyor ba'i lam gyi gnas skabs su rdzogs pa la dgongs pas na sbyor ba'i lam zhes brjod do //
translated: The practice of armor is complete in the context of the path of preparation, and therefore it is called the path of preparation.

original: de bzhin du 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi gnas skabs su rdzogs pas na lam de dag gi rang bzhin du brjod do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'jug pa dang / tshogs dang / nges par 'byung ba ni mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / khyad par gyi gnas skabs su rdzogs pas na lam de dag gi rang bzhin du brjod do //
translated: Similarly, engagement, the collections and definite emergence are complete in the context of seeing, meditation and the special path, and therefore they are called the nature of those paths.

original: de ni mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don to /
analyzed: de ni mdor bstan pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyi don to /
translated: This is the meaning of the two verses of summary.

original: // / don brgyad po de yang re re nas bstan pa'i phyir dang po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni don bcus bstan to //
analyzed: // / don brgyad po de yang re re nas bstan pa'i phyir dang po rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni don bcus bstan to //
translated: The first, the knowledge of all aspects, is taught by ten topics.

original: de la so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed las khyad par du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du'am 'phel bar bya ba'i don gyi phyir gdams ngag go //
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi sems bskyed las khyad par du byang chub tu sems bskyed pa dang / sems bskyed pa mngon sum du bya ba'i don du'am 'phel bar bya ba'i don gyi phyir gdams ngag go //
translated: The generation of the Thought of enlightenment is distinguished from the generation of the thought of the common man, the disciple, and the hermit buddha. It is the instruction for the sake of the actualization of the generation of the thought or for the sake of its increase.

original: gdams ngag gi sgo nas sems bskyed pa ci ltar 'phel zhe na /
analyzed: gdams ngag gi sgo nas sems bskyed pa ci ltar 'phel zhe na /
translated: How does the generation of the thought increase by way of the instruction?

original: gdams ngag yod na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la dad pa dang / spro bas brtson 'grus dang / byang chub kyi sems la sems rtse gcig tu skye ba 'byung bas na ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub kyi sems yang nas yang du dran pa 'byung bas na dran pa dang /
analyzed: gdams ngag yod na byang chub tu sems bskyed pa la dad pa dang / spro bas brtson 'grus dang / byang chub kyi sems la sems rtse gcig tu skye ba 'byung bas na ting nge 'dzin dang / byang chub kyi sems yang nas yang du dran pa 'byung bas na dran pa dang /
translated: If one has instructions, one has faith in arousing bodhicitta, one has the diligence of delight, one has the concentration of arousing bodhicitta one pointedly, one has the mindfulness of repeatedly recalling bodhicitta and one has the wisdom of knowing bodhicitta as it is.üîΩThus one has the factors conducive to liberation.

original: byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i shes rab la sogs pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang de bzhin du rim pa bzhin du 'byung bas de ltar na gdams ngag gi sgo nas sems bskyed pa 'phel ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i shes rab la sogs pa thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang de bzhin du rim pa bzhin du 'byung bas de ltar na gdams ngag gi sgo nas sems bskyed pa 'phel ba yin no //
translated: In that way, bodhicitta increases through instructions.

original: gdams ngag dang ldan pa las dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid kyi dad pa la sogs pa bskyed pas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag rnam pa @111b bzhi bstan to //
analyzed: gdams ngag dang ldan pa las dbang po dang stobs kyi bdag nyid kyi dad pa la sogs pa bskyed pas nges par 'byed pa'i yan lag rnam pa @111b bzhi bstan to //
translated: From possessing instructions, one generates faith and so on that have the nature of the faculties and powers and one is taught the four aspects of the branches of definite discernment.

original: de la gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs su dang po grang ba'i reg pa sel mi nus pa'i dro ba tsam 'byung ba bzhin du ma dad pa la sogs pa bas stobs chung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni drod ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i gnas skabs su dang po grang ba'i reg pa sel mi nus pa'i dro ba tsam 'byung ba bzhin du ma dad pa la sogs pa bas stobs chung ba'i dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni drod ces bya'o //
translated: In this context, the five such as faith that are weaker than lack of faith, etc., are called heat, because at the stage of rubbing the kindling sticks, there is just heat that is not yet able to remove the cold sensation.

original: mnyam par gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni rtse mo zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gyur pa'i gnas skabs na ni rtse mo zhes bya'o //
translated: At the stage of being equal, they are called summits.

original: drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs kyi dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed pa dang / spang bya spong mi nus pa'i phyir dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: drod dang rtse mo'i gnas skabs kyi dad pa la sogs pa lnga ni mya ngan las 'das pa la dbang byed pa dang / spang bya spong mi nus pa'i phyir dbang po lnga zhes bya'o //
translated: The five such as faith at the stages of heat and summits are called the five faculties because they control nirvana and are not yet able to abandon the discards.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa bas stobs che ba'i gnas skabs na ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa bas stobs che ba'i gnas skabs na ni bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: At the stage of being stronger than lack of faith, etc., they are called patience.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa ma lus par spong nus pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa ma lus par spong nus pa'i gnas skabs na ni 'jig rten pa'i chos kyi mchog ces bya'o //
translated: At the stage of being able to abandon all lack of faith, etc., they are called the supreme mundane points.

original: bzod pa dang chos mchog gi gnas skabs na ni ma dad pa la sogs pa 'joms nus pas stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bzod pa dang chos mchog gi gnas skabs na ni ma dad pa la sogs pa 'joms nus pas stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: At the stage of acceptance and the supreme mundane state, they are called powers because one is able to destroy lack of faith and so on.

original: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang rigs dang ldan pa la skye bas /
analyzed: sems bskyed pa la sogs pa'i chos de dag kyang rigs dang ldan pa la skye bas /
translated: These dharmas such as the generation of bodhicitta arise in those who possess the potential.

original: sgrub pa'i rten theg pa chen po'i rigs bstan to //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rten theg pa chen po'i rigs bstan to //
translated: Thus the support for the practice, the Mahayana potential, is taught.

original: rigs dang ldan pa de la yang sgrub pa nyams su blangs pa las 'byung bas sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i dmigs pa bstan to //
analyzed: rigs dang ldan pa de la yang sgrub pa nyams su blangs pa las 'byung bas sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i dmigs pa bstan to //
translated: And for those who possess the potential, the practice arises from engaging in the practice, so the focus of the practice is taught.

original: nyams su len pa de yang 'bras bu med par ma yin pas chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: nyams su len pa de yang 'bras bu med par ma yin pas chos kyi sku'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu ched du bya ba rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: That practice is not without result, so the three aspects of the result, which is the nature of the dharmakaya, are taught.

original: 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i don du lam la nan tan du bya dgos pas spro ba'i brtson 'grus kyi go cha'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob par bya ba'i don du lam la nan tan du bya dgos pas spro ba'i brtson 'grus kyi go cha'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: In order to attain the result, one must apply oneself to the path, so the practice of the armor of enthusiastic diligence is taught.

original: go bgos pa de las 'jug pa 'byung bas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: go bgos pa de las 'jug pa 'byung bas 'jug pa'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: From that armor, engagement arises, so the practice of engagement is taught.

original: 'jug pa dang ldan pa las bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'byung bas tshogs kyi sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldan pa las bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs 'byung bas tshogs kyi sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The practice of the accumulations is taught because the accumulations of merit and wisdom arise from the practice of engagement.

original: tshogs bsags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa 'byung bas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
analyzed: tshogs bsags pa las nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa 'byung bas nges par 'byung ba'i sgrub pa bstan to //
translated: The practice of definite emergence is taught because the practice of definite emergence arises from the accumulation of the accumulations.

original: mdor na sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: mdor na sgrub pa rnam pa bzhi ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba bzhi'i bdag nyid de /
translated: In brief, the four types of practice are the nature of the four applications, such as the complete realization of all aspects and so on.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do //üîΩbyang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam thams cad shes par bya dgos pas dang por nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa ngas sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis lha rnams kyi rnam smin gyi 'od zil gyis mnan pa la sogs pa rnam @112a * //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid do // byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam thams cad shes par bya dgos pas dang por nyan thos byang chub sems dpa'i lam shes pa ngas sangs rgyas kyi 'od kyis lha rnams kyi rnam smin gyi 'od zil gyis mnan pa la sogs pa rnam @112a * //
translated: That is the knowledge of all aspects.

original: pa lnga ni lam shes pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: pa lnga ni lam shes pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The five aspects such as the light of the Buddha outshining the light of the ripening of the gods and so on are the application of the knowledge of the path.

analyzed: drug ni chos mchog gis bsdus so //

original: de la sbyor ba khyad par can rgyud la skyes par mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas shes pas mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig bstan to //
analyzed: de la sbyor ba khyad par can rgyud la skyes par mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas shes pas mtshan nyid dgu bcu rtsa gcig bstan to //

original: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyogs chos /
analyzed: de la shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyogs chos /
translated: The characteristics of knowledge are the qualities of the factors.

original: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i tshul /
analyzed: byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa'i tshul /
translated: The characteristic of function is the mode of existence in the discordant class.

analyzed: khyad par gyi mtshan nyid ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog pa'i tshul / ngo bo nyid ni rtags kyis mtshon @114a * //

original: par bya ba'o //
analyzed: par bya ba'o //
translated: The intrinsic nature is that which is indicated by the reason.

original: de la rang gi rgyud la gtan la 'bebs par byed pa'i tshe ni mkhyen pa gsum chos can no //
analyzed: de la rang gi rgyud la gtan la 'bebs par byed pa'i tshe ni mkhyen pa gsum chos can no //
translated: When one is determining in one's own continuum, the three knowledges are the subject.

translated: The knowledge that the union of sign and possessor of sign is produced from the practice is the person who possesses the aids to penetration.

analyzed: de la zhing dag pa ni bar chad med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pa'i rgyu yin no //

analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa ni log par rtog pa sel ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Skill in means is the cause of eliminating wrong understanding.

translated: The three are taught in terms of the small, medium and great.üîΩIn brief, in the context of the beginner, all paths are the knowledge of the means and the end result, and the practice of the application of all paths is called the complete clear realization of all aspects.üîΩThus, in the context of the complete clear realization of all aspects, the practice of the application of all paths is called its application.

translated: From the culmination of the complete clear realization of all aspects, the clear realization of its summit called the supreme arises, and thus the clear realization of the summit is taught. analyzed: 'o na mthar gyis pa'i nges 'byed dang khyad ci yod ce na /

analyzed: skyes bu btags par yod pa ni chos kyi bdag tu 'dzin pa'o // de la mthong ba'i lam skad cig ma bcu drug yin la /
translated: The conception of the person as imputedly existent is the apprehension of the self of phenomena.üîΩThe path of seeing has sixteen moments.

translated: The complete abandonment of the objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is by the sixteenth.

analyzed: de ltar na bsgom pa'i lam ni sum cu rtsa drug tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the path of cultivation is thirty-sixfold.

analyzed: khyad par gyi lam gyi gnas skabs na log par rtog pa kun spong bas log rtog sel ba bstan to //
translated: In the state of the special path, wrong views are completely abandoned, so the elimination of wrong views is taught.

original: de la rgyu 'bras kyi rim pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa'i nges 'byed rnams rtse mo'i rtags la sogs pa rnam pa bzhi'i sbyor ba'o //

analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa ni mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: The irreversible is the application of seeing and cultivation.

translated: The pure field is the application of the uninterrupted samadhi.

translated: In the case of the gradual type, it is called gradual because one cultivates the six perfections, the six recollections, and the non-substantiality of all things, thirteen in all, in order, from the path of preparation up to the ten stages.

analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis ni pha rol tu phyin pa bcu ka bsdus so //
translated: Among these, the six perfections include all ten perfections.

analyzed: de'i dbang du byas nas de'i dbang du bya ba'i phyir mthar gyis bsgom pa'o //

original: de ltar na mthar gyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ltar na mthar gyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Thus, the summit is cultivated in two ways.

original: de la nyams pa gso ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po la'o //
analyzed: de la nyams pa gso ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po rtul po la'o //
translated: The restoration of the summit is for those of dull faculty.

analyzed: dbang du bya ba yin pa'i phyir bsgom pa'i ni 'bring po la'o //
translated: Cultivation in stages is for those of medium faculty because they are to be guided.

original: mthar gyis pa yongs su rdzogs pa las skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba sbyor ba mthar phyin pa 'byung bas skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa de la gong du bsgom pa'i lam thams cad skad cig
analyzed: mthar gyis pa yongs su rdzogs pa las skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa zhes bya ba sbyor ba mthar phyin pa 'byung bas skad cig ma gcig la mngon par byang chub pa bstan pa de la gong du bsgom pa'i lam thams cad skad cig
translated: The instantaneous approach is taught in the section on the instantaneous approach, which is the final stage of the path of meditation.üîΩThe instantaneous approach is taught in the section on the instantaneous approach, which is the final stage of the path of meditation.

analyzed: de yang mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The instantaneous approach is also classified in four ways:

original: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa dang / gnyis su med pa'o //

original: de nyid skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung bas de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku bstan pa de la sangs rgyas kyi sku ni ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang chos kyi sku ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: de nyid skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung bas de'i 'og tu chos kyi sku bstan pa de la sangs rgyas kyi sku ni ngo bo nyid dang longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa dang chos kyi sku ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: The body of a buddha is classified in four ways: the essential body, the body of perfect enjoyment, the emanation body and the body of truth.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni rang bzhin rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The essential body is the natural purity.

original: chos kyi sku ni dri ma rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni dri ma rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The Dharma body is the purity of the defilements.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu'i mnga' bdag rnams dang lhan cig tu chos kyi longs spyod pa spyod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni sa bcu'i mnga' bdag rnams dang lhan cig tu chos kyi longs spyod pa spyod pa'o //
translated: The beatific body is the enjoyment of the Dharma together with the lords of the ten stages.

original: sprul pa'i sku ni nyan thos la sogs pa la snang la gzugs sna tshogs kyi rtag tu sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
analyzed: sprul pa'i sku ni nyan thos la sogs pa la snang la gzugs sna tshogs kyi rtag tu sems can gyi don byed pa'o //
translated: The emanation body is the constant performance of the aims of beings by means of various forms, appearing to the disciples and so on.

analyzed: de ltar ni sku rnam pa bzhi'o //

analyzed: kha cig ni chos nyid dang chos kyi sku gcig pas na sku ni gsum kho na yin no zhes zer ro //

original: de ni ma yin no //

analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku la mdzad pa med pas na mdzad pa dang bcas pa zhes bya bar mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the essential body has no activity, it is not tenable to say that it is endowed with activity.

analyzed: des na mdzad pa dang bcas pa zhes gsungs pas sku ni rnam @116a * //

original: pa bzhi nyid du bzhed pa yin no //
analyzed: pa bzhi nyid du bzhed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is said to be endowed with activity, the body is accepted as having four aspects.

original: de ltar na skabs brgyad do //
analyzed: de ltar na skabs brgyad do //
translated: Thus, there are eight topics.

original: de la skabs brgyad kyi rim pa ni gnyis te /
analyzed: de la skabs brgyad kyi rim pa ni gnyis te /
translated: The order of the eight topics is twofold:

original: bstan pa'i rim pa dang / skye ba'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rim pa dang / skye ba'i rim pa'o //
translated: the order of teaching and the order of production.

analyzed: de la bstan pa'i rim pa ni rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'bras bur dang por bstan nas rgyu phyis 'chad pa'o ;
translated: The order of teaching is that the knowledge of all aspects is taught first as the result, and its cause is explained later.

original: / skye ba'i rim pa ni de'i sbyor ba dang / de rab dang / de'i go rims dang / de'i mtha' zhes bya ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa la sogs pa sbyor ba bzhi ni sngar bstan la /

translated: The order of production is that the four preparations, such as the full realization of the knowledge of all aspects, are taught first, through the distinctions of its preparation, its culmination, its sequence and its culmination point.

original: 'bras bu chos kyi sku ni phyis bstan to //
analyzed: 'bras bu chos kyi sku ni phyis bstan to //
translated: The result, the body of truth, is taught later.

analyzed: de nyid rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs par rtogs pa yongs su tshol ba'i dus su rnam pa nas thabs mkhas pa'i bar du lam dang / lam gyi rim pa kun bsams pa'i shes rab kyis gtan la phab nas / sems bskyed pa man chad chos mchog yan chad du lam kun gyi sbyor ba nyams su blangs pa ni rnam pa kun mngon par rdzogs so //

translated: When one has practiced all the stages of all the paths by practicing the preparations for all the paths from the clear realization of the path up to the clear realization of all aspects, one has the peak.

original: ma nyams kyang dbang du bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin bsgom pa ni mthar gyis pa'o //
analyzed: ma nyams kyang dbang du bya ba'i phyir go rims bzhin bsgom pa ni mthar gyis pa'o //
translated: When one restores the clear realization of the path if it declines, or cultivates it in order to master it if it does not decline, one has the serial.

analyzed: de ltar go rims bzhin du bsgoms pa las skad cig ma gcig pa la mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: When one attains the clear realization of all aspects in a single moment by cultivating the clear realization of the path in this way in a serial order, one has the instantaneous.

original: de nyid kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de nyid kyi skad cig ma gnyis pa la 'bras bu chos kyi sku 'byung ngo //
